hackathon-description-text: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to make something that does anything, or anything that does something, from scratch—in 24 hours.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer / Jeanne D'Arc Credit Union
Founder/Creative Director at New Vestures; a fashion makerspace
USFirst Robotics Mechanical Mentor,  lifelong problem solver, and Software Engineer at Cisco Systems
Senior Principal Systems Engineer at BAE Systems and 3D printing hobbyist

hackathon-eligibility: Any individual or team may participate in this hackathon.  Everyone must be at least 18 years of age or have a parent or legal guardian present who will be responsible for them during the hackathon.  All participant and parents/guardians must sign liability waivers and acknowledgement of Lowell Makes' Code of Conduct and Safety Rules.
hackathon-requirements:
All creations must do something, and must have been built at Lowell Makes.  Creations must be functional, but may be physical, digital, electronic/electromechanical or be in any other form.  Software, apps and embeded code running on hardware qualifies.
 
All submissions must be completed within the 24-hour period of the hackathon and entrants must be present at the end of the hackathon during the judging and observation period.
hackathon-rules:
For the purposes of this hackathon, "you" means you as an individual or your team.  The only rules are:
1. You must make your creation at Lowell Makes within the 24-hour hackathon window. You may bring in components or sub-assemblies that were purchased as a complete part, but they must be assembled into your creation by you in our space.
2. Creations must not be dangerous to those observing or touching them.  For example: No exposed sharp edges or points, no exposed high voltage and/or high current electricity, etc.  Use your head, and ask if you are uncertain.
3. Respect everyone.
4. Have fun and learn.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=47 Lee Street, Lowell, MA 01852, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Based on the participant's stated plan and goal, how complete is their creation?
True or False: Does the creation do something?
How original, unique or novel is the creation?
Does the creation demonstrate techniques or concepts which might educate those who learn about it, especially in speaking with the creator(s) of it?
